snippet: The interior secretary says that jobs in tourism and outdoor recreation far outweigh the potential loss of employment from limiting mining in the region.
abstract: The interior secretary says that jobs in tourism and outdoor recreation far outweigh the potential loss of employment from limiting mining in the region.
lead_paragraph: Interior Secretary Ken Salazar formally signed a 20-year moratorium on new uranium and other hard rock mining claims on a million acres of federal land around the Grand Canyon on Monday, saying it was a "serious and necessary step" to preserve the mile-deep canyon and the river that runs through it.

headline.main: Interior Secretary Signs Grand Canyon Mining Ban
